page.title: 16SAND AND GRAVEL PITS
page.content: Sand and gravel is transported all over the country,about 300 to 500 tonnes of it each day.The sand they extract is {sharp sand,builders {sand,pea graveland some larger}gravel. All this comes from comparatively shallow pits. The lorries have first to be weighed empty,then they load up and weigh again.The weight of gravel is found by subtracting the empty weight from the full weight. The sand and gravel are found in Mathon because it is situated on the side of a stream,the water carried the sand and gravel down when the glaciers of the last ice age melted.Mud then covered it and fields formed until it was later dug out again.
